block.p: I'm no Luddite, but the very word ''e-book'' gives me the creeps (The Way We Live Now: Jacob Weisberg, June 4). My love of reading today is rooted in my childhood: being read to while I turned the pages of an oversize storybook, buying paperbacks at my school's periodic book fairs, carrying stacks of books home from the library, running to meet the bookmobile that visited my rural neighborhood in the summertime.

To think that someday my children, or my children's children, may trade these experiences for a quick download in front of a humming computer monitor is just depressing.
